head.title: Ms. Harned Wed To W. W. Hobert

hedline.hl1: Ms. Harned Wed To W. W. Hobert

block.p: LEAD: Julie Colwell Harned, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John C. Harned of Boston, was married yesterday to William Wade Hobert, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert D. Hobert of Minneapolis. The Rev. Jack Silvey Miller, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Old Lyme,

LEAD: Julie Colwell Harned, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John C. Harned of Boston, was married yesterday to William Wade Hobert, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert D. Hobert of Minneapolis. The Rev. Jack Silvey Miller, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Old Lyme,

Julie Colwell Harned, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John C. Harned of Boston, was married yesterday to William Wade Hobert, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert D. Hobert of Minneapolis. The Rev. Jack Silvey Miller, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Old Lyme, Conn.

Ms. Hobert, 24 years old, is an assistant to the director of the Edwynn Houk Gallery in Chicago, a dealer in 20th-century photography. She and her husband graduated from Wesleyan University. Her father is the chief financial officer of the Infovest Corporation, an information services company in Chicago, and a former chief financial officer of the Penn Central Corporation in New York. Her mother, Jill W. Harned, designs kitchen interiors.

The bridegroom, 26, is an options trader in the currency division of the Mitsui Bank in Chicago. His mother, Lucy G. Hobert, teaches history at the St. Paul Academy and Summit School in St. Paul. His father is the chairman of Business Testing Services in Minneapolis.
